measured_by: drift rate bias parameter of the Drift-Diffusion Model (DDM)
justification: The authors state that "if a manipulation results in a drift rate bias, then it can be assumed to have perceptual effects" (Germar et al., 2014; Voss et al., 2008).

measured_by: starting point shift parameter of the Drift-Diffusion Model (DDM)
justification: In the same passage, the paper notes that "if it [the manipulation] results in a starting point shift, then it can be assumed to have cognitive effects."

The Methods section explains that participants "rated their confidence about the accuracy of the decision on a 4-point scale by pressing '1', '2', '3', or '4' on the keyboard ('1' = low confidence, '4' = high confidence)."

measured_by: Point of Subjective Equality (PSE) derived from psychometric function
justification: The Analysis section states that for choice data the authors fit a psychometric curve and that "µ is the point of subjective equality (PSE)… We performed paired-sample t-tests comparing µ between different cues… to determine the effects of cues on the indexes."
